message: The amount of arguments to pass to class-based generic views starts to get pretty unrelated to url routing.

You don't *have* to pass arguments to class-based views your urls. I use them in a declarative way in views.py, I even declare view = ViewClass.as_view() at the bottom of the class definition. This way in urls.py you just import & reference the view callable
Is it just me, or are urlpatterns in urls.py starting to get messy? Are there any efforts to clean this up, and perhaps introduce controllers?
